    • Method Detail

      • parseString

        public java.lang.String parseString(java.lang.String jsText,
                           java.lang.String path)
                             throws org.mozilla.javascript.EvaluatorException
        parseString This is the main entry point. Takes a string and the path to the file the string was loaded from and returns a plain SJS string with all EJS and macros translated. If the path ends in ".ejs", then the file is assumed to be EJS text
        Parameters:
        jsText - Javascript Text to parse
        path - of of file that produced the supplied text. Used in error messages, and to determine type of text
        Returns:
        translated SJS only text
        Throws:
        org.mozilla.javascript.EvaluatorException

      • appendText

        public void appendText()
        appendText handles text tokens. Basically any charachters between the known tokens

        public int curLine()

        Returns:
        the current line of the script
